title: 820-4924 Short on Vcore
message: I'm to the point where I don't even want to touch these boards anymore when I measure a short on vcore (0.5Ω in this case.) I can't remember a time when it wasn't the CPU. Is there anything else I should look for before letting this go? The board looks mostly clean, but the customer reported it as a spill. R7202 looks like it probably got hit. PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING wasn't shorted. Board is cycling. PP5V_S0 is cycling. Fan will occasionally spin up when power is applied.

title: 820-4924 Short on Vcore
message: yeah 0.5 is too low on CPU, RIP.
